reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised how good the food is here! It is a modest store front but don't let it fool you! The pizza is great, you can taste the freshness. Sooo much better than the big chain companies. The pasta was amazing! 12$ and you get a giant serving, enough for four bowls of pasta with garlic knots and a side salad. Highly recommend the napoletana linguine. Service was great too. They went out of their way to provide extra napkins and side of ranch.

Based on online reviews and its close proximity to my hotel, I ordered delivery during my stay in Ann Arbor.  I ordered a half Greek salad and an Italian sausage pizza.  The salad was pure perfection!  I highly recommend it.  The pizza was also very good (I enjoyed leftovers the next day, too).  I took off one star because the delivery didn't include napkins or utensils.  I mean, I'm staying in a hotel--do you really expect me to have these things readily on hand?  I had to go down to the front desk and request a plastic fork so I could eat my salad.  You guys have great food, so please don't forget the little things that travelers in hotels need.  :)

Just get pizza from this place. Chicken or Pasta is waste of money. Pizza is the best. Do not dine in. Order to go. Bathroom is horrible. They have cleaning problem. The lady who run the place trying her best she is nice. But they need to spend money on the place.

I don't know how this place has so many good reviews. I tried them for the first time last night and will not return. I stopped in for carryout pizza by the slice for my boyfriend and me. First of all, the layout of the restaurant is dysfunctional. The kitchen/working area is so small, I don't know how the three employees were able to move around. And that's another thing. The floor behind the counter has plastic pallets on it and the employees were walking around on the pallets. It was one of the strangest things I've ever seen in a pizza place. The cash register is on a small counter where other customers were just standing around waiting for their orders, so it was impossible to try to place my order and pay. After forcing my way to the register, I ordered two cheese and two pepperoni slices. The cashier could barely figure out how to price them. Cheese and pepperoni are the most basic thing you can order! There were two other customers waiting for their orders and the staff was clearly confused who was supposed to get what order. The employees were running around manically and acting like they could barely comprehend what was going on in the store with three customers! I also noticed there was no hand washing going on as food was being handled. No employee had a clear designated spot to work. They were all just doing whatever. Who manages like that? When I finally received my order they only gave me three slices. I repeated my order of two cheese and two pepperoni. A few minutes later I received my order in a small box and thought to myself "how in the world are there four slices of New York style pizza in here? Did the employee stack them on top of each other?" I was so annoyed I walked out to my car, opened the box, and guess what? Three slices of pizza stacked on top of each other. Unbelievable is all I could think. And who stacks pizza on top of each other? I walked back in and told them my order was still wrong.  A different employee took a slice of cheese pizza, threw some pepperoni on top, and put it in the oven. This is weird, right? Then she pulled it out of the oven and told me to have a great night in an extremely phony voice. She didn't even apologize for the poor service. When I was a teenager, I worked at Cottage Inn, a restaurant with a very large menu and variety of items. I could run the register, take orders, and make all the food by myself on a busy night. It might be hard, but I could certainly handle it on my own. This place can't even get pizza by the slice right with two attempts and three employees working. I was extremely embarrassed for them and would hate to see what it's like when they're actually busy. The pizza was mediocre. Try at your own risk!

My husband liked their pizza a lot and ordered from them dozens of times we recently moved and are now 4 miles away if you view the longest google map route. We have had them deliver before as the route max time also shows as 9 minutes after placing our order and waiting over 30 minutes we received a call back saying we are too far and they will not deliver to us, this woman is the same rude woman we have spoken to before. We were told it would be arriving in 45 minutes when we placed our order and gave our address and he took our payment information as usual. The correct thing to do would have been to call and apologize call back explain they would still deliver our order but in the future they will no longer deliver. She also stated we are over 6 miles away which is not true no matter what route you take. She said it's just too far and did not offer any apology. This is very expensive for what you get- we are dissapointes with our experience and would not recommend this and will be going to many of the other 50 pizza options instead from now on.

First time here, and most likely will not be back. Food was good however service was lacking. Wait staff was inattentive and never looked past the table he was at to see if others needed assistance. The ground beef has a nearly equal portion of peppers in it, something that is not expected. I love peppers, but not that much! Worth a visit for sure, but not my favorite place to go by any means.

Probably one of the best options for Mexican food in Apple Valley if not the best. Their table side guacamole is excellent and the prices are more than reasonable for what you get. They have also proven themselves very attentive and helpful when we dined there with a larger group. There are cheaper options probably for Mexican fair but you get what you pay for. They also have coupons in the paper fairly often and the fajitas for two is an excellent money saver and honestly is enough food for three or even four people.

We stopped in for a late lunch as this is one of our favorite restaurants. Service is always good but this time we were lucky enough to get Elias D as our waiter. He has to be one of the kindest and most efficient waiters. He had our chips and salsas to the table before we had even settled in. His knowledge of the menu was outstanding and not to mention the guacamole he made for us at our table was awesome. Thanks Elias D for the very enjoyable experience. :)

Decor is lovely! Service was quick and very courteous even during peek hrs on Friday night. The food was fine but I had been hoping for an authentic Mexican place. Here they served ranch along w their mild salsa to go with the (excellent) chips and “nacho cheese sauce” over the chimichangas. Just wasn’t what I had been looking for.

Not sure what happened to this place. Last two times we were here the service has been incredibly slow. Took over 30 minutes to get our food when it wasn't even busy. Food is good but comes out cold. The woman who sat us threw the menus on the table, she also happened to be our waitress. After that it took her approximately 10 minutes to come back to get our drink order. We come here often, but after these last few visits, I'm not sure we will be back.

Very small museum, cool knowledgeable guides that seem to master a lot of the countrie's historic, traditional and mythological stories. In an hour you can see most part of it. There is a little shop outside of the museum where you can buy some artifacts that are also available elsewhere at lesser price.
I like this place but I would love it if it had enough traditional and local object. I think it doesn't represent enough the national heritage

I loved visiting this museum. I wish I could've taken pictures. Nevertheless, our tour guide, William Dayo, was very well versed in each of the exhibits. It was really nice to have someone with us who gave us in depth information on what we were viewing. It gave us a deeper understanding and appreciation for each of the artifacts.
It was nice. The museum has a lot to offer in cultural history and I was happy to see them opened on a Sunday.

This museum continues the tradition of equating Western African culture and history mainly with masks (sarcasm). It could almost be interchangeable with the museum's in Dakar and Bamako except they both have a second floor dedicated to textiles. 

Granted, the masks are interesting and high quality, but they are completely decontextualized with cryptic captions an little explanation tying anything together.

There is one table showing the evolution of money that was nice. 

It's one of the few times I wished there was a museum gift shop with some books. 

Weirdly they don't allow photography either, as if history should be hidden. 

Avoid the restaurant out back it is way overpriced and there are better maquis around.

very beautiful church next to the river. i came here in the evening at 3-4pm. there is no light on inside the church. the window glass is more visible to catch the shot. very beautiful scene. i love the story on the window and wall and the statue of the Angel and Jesus.

Very peaceful, nice architecture, worth a stop and look anytime you are in the area. Closest Ferry stop is Marine. There are some nice cafes in the area too. For pictures visit my Instagram, Wildalaskaken_official.
Nice​ place, beautiful​ architecture.​ But​ it​ is​ in​ the​ grounds  of​ a​ school​ so​ I​ couldn't​ get​ inside.​ The​ local​ area​ has​ good​ food​ and​ a​ nice​ vibe
Beautiful church beside Chao Phraya river, worth coming if you intend to visit Talat Noi.
Beautiful church.  Can take a taxi boat to get there.
Almost every kind of fast food is avaible. Midnight and Noon deals have special discount. Separate family sitting area. Play area for kids.
Delicious food. Must visit fast food chain of Bahawalpur. Their pizza is even good
If you love fast food and you are lahori... U may not like much... But this restaurant is much better than others in fast food
Service is a little bit slow. but taste is good. You can visit with your family and friends. A good palace for a meetup.

It's a fast food chain with variety of menu including pizzas, burgers and many more. Taste is an good. It's an economical restaurant. But staff have got problem with their attitude. Management needs to sort it out.

Giving it 4 Stars as this place has been one of our favourites for almost 2 decades. However, there seems to be a problem with their buffet Sea Fiesta annual promotion. Last year, one of our party got food poisoning after eating the buffet. This year (2019), two people got severe food poisoning and a third had a bad stomach after eating the buffet! There won't be a 3rd time as we'll avoid the buffet at this place. 
However, stick to the items on the menu and we've never had issues with any of the dishes. I'd guess because they're cooked to order! 
Notwithstanding the issues with the buffet, this is still one of the best places to eat. Extremely busy in the evenings. 
Used to love sitting outside, wish they'd be allowed to bring the outside seating back.

One of the best managed and popular restaurant in Karachi. Quality of food is excellent. Famous for Bar B.Q items but other items are also delicious. Staff are courteous. Cutlery and crockery are good. Prices are affordable compare to all surrounding area.
4 Star: Sitting chairs were more comfortable in the past.
Pro tip: Always try to make a reservation at Roof top. You can call them as late as 1 hour before your visit.

Indeed this is the best restaurant for desi food in town. One of the oldest and best food option available in Karachi. Specially known for large family and friends gatherings. Food quality is extremely good. It is always crowded but they try very hard to keep the service quick and good, and most of the time they succeed as well. Multiple floor indoor and rooftop outdoor dining area available. Wallet parking is available. Cash and card both accepted as payment options. They also have take away and home delivery services.

The place is good. Cannot think of any other words to describe it. So yea, just plain good. Been there several times but still feel there's something missing. Can't decide what. Though, loved the brunch! You won't be wrong if you are planning to treat the loved ones, friends or colleague etc. Can't say if they offer the best food.

One of the best managed  and popular restaurant in Karachi. Quality of food is excellent. Famous for Bar B.Q items but other items are also delicious. Staff are courteous. Cutlery and crockery are good. Prices are affordable compare to all surrounding area.
